Though too late but it may help respected Mr Robert Knight and many others. I wanted to have same type of notifications on default lock screen of my Redmi Note 9 Pro (Global ROM). Neither this nor any other app could do that. We all know troubled settings of MIUI. I tried changing different setting and finally I was able to get what I wanted (i.e. full content of messages and other notifications on lock screen without unlocking the phone screen) It is now working best with following settings (order of settings may be different):- 1. Settings……….Notifications………Notification Shade …….. Enabled. 2. Notification Shade…..MIUI. 3. Lock Screen…..Wake Lock Screen for Notifications. 4. Lock screen Notifications ….Format…… Show notifications and content. 5. Must enable all apps or some that you want to show notifications on lock screen. 6. Additional Settings …… Enable Developers Options (Only visible by pressing “MIUI Version” 8-10 times in about phone)………Disable MIUI Optimization. 7. Finally…….. Must change or apply any wallpaper (not the theme wallpaper) to lock screen. 8. Now I get all notifications on lock screen with full content which may be viewed in detail by pulling down a notification. Once pulled down, it also has options of quick reply incl Mark as Read, Delete and Open App etc.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Q: When will the secure lockscreen (pattern/PIN) be implemented? It is not possible to create a custom, secure lockscreen for Android. Other apps that have this feature only pretend to be secure, but in the real world there's always a way to bypass them. You could see this answer in the help section.

If you happen to leave a Hangouts or Facebook conversation open, any new messages will be marked as read when AcDisplay turns on your screen, meaning that the notification will be removed, and to the sender it will look like you have read their message. They will then wonder why you refuse to respond, and you will eventually lose all your friends.
